The all NEW Enviroute comes with improved features which will let you know if either the M48 Severn bridge or the M4 Prince Of Wales bridge is closed or open in either direction.
This new version comes with improved push notifications, a more effective API (backed up with physical and LIVE monitoring of the bridges in person!), additional info on lane closures, and traffic in either direction.
Here is some info on the Severn Crossings and just why this app is NEEDED for the people of Chepstow! 
Enviroute (Original) has been running for nearly 18 months now completely free of charge, and has over 200 5-Star ratings and reviews.  This NEW improved, paid version will help create more technology projects for the people of Chepstow and the surrounding areas.
More features are on their way for Enviroute, and we'll be adding surrounding roads / routes such as the M49 along with routes into Bristol, the M5, and more.
If you don't know about the original problems commuters have experienced with the Severn crossings, read on for some background...
The Severn bridges based between England and wales are major connections for the M4 and M48 motorways. Traditionally both crossings / bridges have been owned and operated by private companies.

“Is the bridge open” and Enviroute have created an app that allows local residents and commuters to check the status of both bridges in order to plan their routes more effectively. From time to time the bridges are closed due to maintenance and/or adverse weather conditions and, since the ownership of the Severn bridges has changed there has been a lack of reliable communications around the status of the M48 Severn bridge and the M4 Severn Bridge.

“Is the bridge open” is here to help with this and to provide information on when either of the Severn Bridges are closed or partially closed.
Severn bridge updates at the touch of a button instead of endless maps, websites or twitter accounts. 
Find out instantly is the Severn Bridge is open and get updates sent directly to your device (Enviroute NEW now has this feature!) before you set off on your journey.

Train Beacon shows estimated, interpolated Great Britain train positions in augmented reality and on a map. Point your phone in the approximate direction that the track is running and see the estimated, interpolated position and distance of trains from your nearest station as beacons overlaid on-screen in AR (augmented reality).

Find Great Britain real-time train times almost instantly from your nearest stations. Displays platform information where available. Automatically loads train times from your nearest station or loads train times from a station that you select from the stations screen. Filter train times by destination station to quickly find the timetable and live real-time train time information that you’re looking for.

Futuristic high tech features

Widgets - requires iOS 14 or higher

Easily see train times, cancellations, rail incidents and service status on your homescreen.

Incidents

Easily see information about the service status and news about rail incidents and current / future planned maintenance. The incidents screen includes information such as the incident details, routes affected, date/s of incident and direct links to the relevent National Rail Enquiries page and map, where available.

AR (augmented reality) mode - requires iOS 13 or higher

Picture real-time train information in an interactive real-world environment. See nearby trains and railway stations in an immersive augmented reality experience. The app will locate trains that are departing from your nearest station and display them. Tapping on a train reveals more information about its calling points and last reported location. AR mode is available on iOS 13 or higher.

Train Tracker

Using it’s advanced geo-location capabilities, combined with real-time train data and it’s UK rail network map, the app predicts the estimated, interpolated location of trains at any given time. The estimated train location is displayed on a map, with information about whether the service is currently running early, on-time or late.

High precision information

The app can report times from intermediary passing points such as junctions, providing you with a high level of precision and accuracy about the current status of a given train’s journey. Packed with detailed train information like number of carriages, train category, power type (eg Electric Multiple Unit), timing load (eg Class 323), planned maximum speed (eg 90mph max), seating classes, reservations, catering, and operating characteristics (eg Driver Only Operation). Please note that this information is only available if this data has been supplied by the Train Operating Company. Some TOCs do not supply carriage data.

Customer Feedback

"Thanks to the JUST bought @TrainBeacon app, light bags and running legs trained with @LondonCityAC - just swapped trains at READING, with 2 minutes crossover time. All makes for a GREAT #SundayMorning! #Staycation adventure to #Cornwall” - James Moyse - Journalist at Sky News

"@TrainBeacon who’s behind this app?? You’ve satisfied my nerdy needs and I am so impressed as to how slick it is. Well done”

"love the AR mode"

Safety Information

Not for use in safety critical applications, level crossings, etc. Train position is estimated from latest available timing point data and may be incorrect. Care must be taken during use. Other trains may be present that are not indicated in the AR or train tracker mode of the app such as trains not stopping at the nearest station and also freight trains. Freight and non passenger trains are not displayed in the app. For your safety do not use your phone while you walk and take extreme care using the app near trains and railways.

Hardware requirements

* AR mode and the augmented reality features of the app require iOS 13 or higher, and an iPhone 6S, SE or later device, or an iPad 2017 or later. Widgets require iOS 14 or higher *

This comprehensive guide shows you all you need to know to hike the Cape to Cape Track, which runs from Cape Naturaliste to Cape Leeuwin in the Margaret River Region of Western Australia.

This App has many innovative features that make it way more useful than a paper guidebook or a website!

The Cape to Cape Track is one of the best kept secrets in the world. If you have a chance to walk the Track, you will not be disappointed!

The App has beautiful photographs, extremely detailed information, built-in maps and GPS support. So you cannot get lost and will not miss anything.

NO INTERNET OR MOBILE COVERAGE IS NEEDED to use this guide. This is very important because most of the track has no internet or mobile coverage. The excellent maps work without using any data, WiFi connection, or internet. So it's fast and won't cost you money. 

It's very interactive; turn on your phone or tablet's GPS from within the App, then follow the track and you will never get lost again! Also see exactly where to park to take shorter day hikes, where to get water and food, and where the best sights, beaches and attractions are. Note that GPS works everywhere - you don't need mobile network reception for it to work.

Each map is marked up to show you viewpoints, attractions, toilets, places to get water, the best beaches, where to camp and more. Tap any map marker to show much more information about that place.

It's like having your own personal tour guide in your pocket that is showing you exactly where to turn at those unmarked crossroads, and it can be quickly referenced to show you the name of the beach or town you are on or in. It is easier than using a paper guide book or a paper map and compass because you can instantly see where you are.

We suggest which way you should walk the track and give you the distances between campsites or paid (comfy!) accommodation to help you in planning your hike. 

FEATURES:
- We describe beaches, sights, camping, accommodation and more

Streets is the only app capable of displaying 360° Street View panoramas on the Apple Watch. Just turn your wrist or pan to turn around in any direction. Use the digital crown to zoom. Streets for Apple Watch automatically syncs favorites and recent searches with your iPhone.


OPEN FROM MAPS & OTHER APPS 
“Open location in Streets” displays nearby panoramas from websites, from „Maps“ or „Contacts“, or from many other apps that support sharing of locations and addresses. DRAG & DROP
On iPad or Mac, drag a pin location from the Maps app, a contact, or a textual address into the Streets app to find nearby panoramas. Even geotagged photos can be dropped in Streets to find 360° spherical images near the photo location.


COMMUNICATIVE
Share Street View panoramas using drag-and-drop (on iPad) or the share sheet. Handoff and AirDrop let you easily transfer the currently viewed panorama between multiple devices. Mark panoramas as favorites that are automatically synced between devices. Rename favorites and organize them in folders.


2000+ GALLERY PLACES 
More than 2000 hand-picked “Gallery Places” show spectacular places such as museums, castles, national parks, ski slopes and even underwater attractions. Geysers in Yellowstone national park, old masterpieces in Amsterdam’s van Gogh museum or NASA’s rocket launch pad in Cape Kennedy are just a few of the breathtaking places waiting to be explored. Tulum – Be Your Own Guide GPS locates and navigates you anywhere within the Maya ruins of Tulum in Quintana Roo, Mexico without using any external data.  There’s no data usage for your mobile device’s automatic ability to locate satellite based cell signals, so no expensive charges apply for using the app.  Created by renowned Maya archaeologist Dr. Edwin Barnhart, the Tulum app provides detailed information about virtually every feature of the site. The “What Is That” function uses your gps location and allows you to point your mobile device at any structure to learn more about it. Photos of each structure are included, as well as drawings and photos of the features inside the temples – ones you can’t see because they are barred from tourist access.  With the Tulum app, you can see the incredible murals that other visitors can’t!  

The Tulum app also includes:
•General history of Tulum
•Ed’s Tour – a recommended walking route
•A complete buildings and features list
•Personalizable photo and video galleries to remember your visit
•Bibliographical references

Whether you are planning on visiting Tulum or just want to learn more about the site, the Tulum app is an invaluable tool for anyone who wants to learn more about the ancient city.  No other source of Tulum information, book or otherwise, is more complete.  And thanks to wifi connections at selected restaurants in Tulum visitor’s center, you can download it data charge free right at the entrance to the ruins!

The Three Peaks of Pen-y-ghent, Ingleborough and Whernside are among the best-known in the Yorkshire Dales National Park. Every year thousands come to reach the top of at least one or to conquer all three in one go. 


The app contains route details for the classic 24-mile circular walk, route maps for the individual peaks, Whernside, Pen-y-ghent and Ingleborough and four other shorter walks in the Three Peaks area. Don’t just come for the day, come for the stay and explore more of this spectacular area and its scenery.  


This GPS enabled app provides reassurance as you follow the arrow along your chosen route. It will also show you how far you are around the route. 


This app has been developed alongside our National Park Yorkshire Three Peaks Rangers who have added points of interest along the routes for you. 


The app also includes important safety advice and the code of conduct, which will help  you stay safe on the walks and help protect our  local communities. 


The app is not a mapping tool. You must take other forms of navigation with you and know how to use them. We recommend you have an OS Explorer OL2 Yorkshire Dales (Southern and Western) map with you. 


Using GPS tracking uses more of your battery than normal – do not rely solely on this app when walking.  


Always be prepared, conditions can change rapidly in an upland area such as the Three Peaks. 


You must read the safety information contained in this app before using the route information.  
  
The Yorkshire Three Peaks are very fragile environments, and the public rights of way network is under pressure from the hundreds of thousands of visitors that come to enjoy it each year. Maintaining the paths in the Yorkshire Three Peaks area costs on average £35 per metre. 



The proceeds of this app all go towards helping the Yorkshire Dales National Park with this work.

BPVNY, l'appli 100 % pratique qui vous aide à préparer et profiter de votre voyage à New York !

J'ai créé cette appli comme une extension de mon blog https://www.bons-plans-voyage-new-york.com/
Vous y retrouverez toutes les infos utiles pour organiser votre séjour mais aussi pour vous rendre la vie sur place plus facile.

Passionné par la ville de New York où je me rends régulièrement et dont je suis devenu au fil des ans spécialiste, je partage depuis 2008 mes découvertes et bons plans sur mon blog (le forum et les réseaux sociaux associés), mon appli mobile et mon guide papier (GO New York, aux éditions Nomades).
J'ai également créé l'agence de voyage https://www.new-york-en-francais.fr/ qui organise des visites guidées et activités touristiques francophones à New York.

Que propose l'appli BPVNY ?

L'appli BPVNY, c'est avant tout une carte de New York sur laquelle vous pouvez vous géolocaliser en temps réel (grâce au GPS) sans avoir besoin d'être connecté à internet. L'appli fonctionne en effet hors ligne (offline), ce qui vous permet de l'utiliser sans jamais consommer votre forfait téléphonique (autrement dit, l'appli fonctionnera même si vous êtes en mode avion !).
La carte compte plusieurs centaines de points d'intérêt triés sur le volet. Vous avez en outre la possibilité de créer une liste de favoris, et même d'ajouter vos propres points d'intérêt sur la carte !

L'appli BPVNY, c'est aussi :

- Des articles sur toutes les choses à savoir avant de partir et une fois sur place
- Les plans officiels du métro et du bus (accessibles d'une simple touche !)
- Des plannings-types pour vous aider à prévoir et organiser vos activités
- Un éditeur de planning (avec la possibilité de créer et sauvegarder plusieurs plannings)
- La liste des réservations à ne pas oublier avant de partir (avec les liens vers les différents portails de réservation)
- Un calculateur de pourboires (pour le taxi, le resto...)
- Un calculateur de taxes (pour le shopping)
- Un outil de conversion € - $
- Des checklists pour être sûr de ne rien oublier avant le départ (avec la possibilité de créer ses propres checklists)
- Un guide de conversation français-anglais
- Une affiche I love BPVNY (pour faire un clin d’œil à la communauté BPVNY !)

Naturellement, l'appli continuera de s'enrichir au fil de l'eau et proposera toujours plus de services pour répondre aux besoins du plus grand nombre.
N'hésitez donc pas à me faire part de vos remarques et suggestions d'amélioration !

Alex les bons plans

Auteur : Alexandre Vendé
Développeurs : Corentin Larroque, Romain Benmansour, Harold Fritsch & Clément Tissier

eCurrency is far more than an easy to use currency converter and handy calculator. It supports over 200 popular currencies; works without active internet connection and even supports custom rates. eCurrency offers rich graphical charts for all exchange rates and supports calculations with historical exchange rates, making this the perfect tool for business, overseas travel and for anyone interested in currency trading.

eCurrency offers the following features:

► Easy-to-use appealing interface
► One screen for all major functionalities
► Designated keypad for fast number entry; plus a handy built-in math’s calculator
► Configures up to 8 converters; swipe through as on the iPhone‘s home screen
► Supports over 200 currencies (for a full list see: http://bit.ly/knBkeS)
► Detailed graphical charts for all exchange rates (1-week, 1-month, 3-months, 6-months, 1-year, 2-years, and 5-years)
► Automatic setting of home currency and number formatting 
► Reliable functionality: No active internet connection required
► Exchange rates automatically updated on startup (Automatic update can be deactivated to avoid roaming costs)
► Supports custom exchange rate entry
► One touch reverse currency conversion
► Special ‘shake to inverse calculation’ feature
► Select and create a list of preferred currencies for fast access


==Easy to use interface==
eCurrency interface is designed for ease of use. Just start the application and type in the amount you want to convert and eCurrency converts instantly. Tap on one of the flags to change the currency you want to convert to. A built-in calculator allows for math calculations. The current exchange rate and rate change compared to the previous day is conveniently displayed in the main interface.

==Favorites Support==
eCurrency supports over 200 currencies. The “Favorites” functionality allows you to define the currency pairs you use as favorites. To create a new favorite go into the “Settings” and touch the “+” Button. You can swipe through all your favorites on the main calculation interface just as you swipe the pages on the iPhone’s home screen.

== Charts and Historic Rates==
eCurrency provides detailed historical charts for all exchange rates. Just rotate the device to landscape, to view the chart for the active currency pair. You can switch the chart display between a 1-week, 1-month, 3-month, 6-month, 1-year, 2-year or 5-year period. Tap on the chart to display the exact exchange rate tor a particular day. Tap and hold to use a specific exchange rate for historic calculations.

== Exchange Rate Updates ==
eCurrency updates exchange rates automatically on every start-up or on demand. You can turn off automatic updates to avoid roaming costs. The conversion and calculation functionally works completely offline using the latest downloaded exchange rates; the display of historical charts requires an active internet connection.

==Rates Provider==
eCurrency is not dependant on any single data-source. The application obtains its exchange rates from our self-developed Currency-Provider-engine that aggregates rates data from multiple sources to secure the reliability of exchange rate updates.

== Tutorial & Support==
On the first startup a short self-running demo is displayed to introduce you to the app. We appreciate any reviews or comments you may have on eCurrency in iTunes. If you have any questions please contact us directly, as we are unable to respond to your enquiries via iTunes.

Welcome to KrugerExplorer – the all-in-one encyclopedia to Kruger National Park.

Whether you are planning your South African safari, need the perfect companion guide for your self-drive Kruger experience, or simply want to explore Kruger from the comfort of home, you will find everything you need in the KrugerExplorer App.

This App explores the Greater Kruger in unparalleled detail, and includes:
- The most extensive Kruger wildlife Field Guide ever created.
- Guided Routes that share our knowledge of the park’s roads from years of exploring Kruger.
- The most up-to-date Kruger Maps available, helping you navigate the park’s 3,500km road network including several newly opened roads.
- Live GPS map with downloadable offline maps so you always know your location.
- Extensive sections on Kruger’s Rest Camps, Itineraries, Accommodation, plus exclusive Special Offers & Competitions.
- Thousands of stunning photographic images and audio files to reveal all the beauty of Kruger’s wildlife.
- And once downloaded, the App works 100% offline – perfect for exploring the Kruger!

The Field Guide section is unprecedented in its focus on Kruger’s wildlife. It includes over 700 species profiles detailing physical characteristics, behaviours and locations, and each is accompanied by breathtaking photography to aid identification. The 700+ species profiles cover:
- All 148 mammal species ever recorded in Kruger, including the best places to find them.
- Over 60 footprint graphics so you can identify wildlife spoor.
- 500+ bird species, including all of Kruger’s resident, migrant visitor and vagrant records since 2010. Stunning bird photography includes male, female, juvenile and breeding plumage where relevant.
- Over 500 bird audio files bring the sounds of the bush to life.
- 60+ profiles of commonly encountered reptiles and invertebrates, including crocodiles, snakes, lizards, tortoises, butterflies, spiders & much more.

The Guided Routes use our experience from many years exploring Kruger to create 70+ incredible journeys through the park:
- The routes are like having an in-person guide in your pocket. Each includes extensive commentary that doesn’t just say, “Take that road because it’s good for lions,” but instead explains the geology of each area, which in turn informs the flora that grows there, the herbivores that eat that flora and, ultimately, the predators that hunt those herbivores.
- Each route will help you develop an intimate insight into Kruger’s incredible wilderness.
- Each of the rest camps and entrance gates is covered with short, medium and full-day routes to explore.

The Maps are the most detailed and up-to-date available:
- They include newly opened roads and correct errors found in the maps available in the park shops. 
- For first-time visitors to Kruger, note that you are not provided with a map and must buy one from a park shop at a cost similar to this App.
- The live GPS map means you'll never get lost.

With over half a million words of content, KrugerExplorer is the most comprehensive and unparalleled encyclopedia for the Greater Kruger ever created.

Since launching in 2019, the App has had a superb reception from fans and received wonderful accolades:
- Downloads in over 80 countries

The Foundation’s Preservation Fund helps support preservation, rehabilitation, and capital projects for official Freedom Trail historic sites; these projects help avoid, minimize, or mitigate adverse effects of the elements and manmade wear and tear of Boston’s precious 17th-, 18th-, and 19th-century sites.

summary.label:
Get the full Massachusetts experience with this combo of walking and driving tours around Boston!

You’ll find ten tours in one app - all highly entertaining, thoroughly researched and prepared by local guides.

■ Boston Freedom Trail:
Walk in the footsteps of the founding fathers. Hear the story of how the first sparks of revolution flew in Boston, and how they became an inferno! The architects of the revolution come alive along this historic trail at sites like the Boston Common and the Old North Church, where Paul Revere’s famous lanterns once hung.

■ Harvard Square:
Explore one of the most famous and beautiful universities in the world! Just about every brick in this campus is steeped in history, even predating the United States of America! We’re here to bring all that history to the surface. Get ready to hear about Harvard’s beginnings way back in the 1600s, and how it evolved from a tiny college to one of the most prestigious institutions in the world.

■ Harborwalk:
Prepare for Boston’s historic waterfront to come to life! Walk the same seaside piers as revolutionaries, smugglers, and patriotic rioters. Immerse yourself in the ship-rigging, ale-drinking, shanty-singing days of Colonial Boston, during the fiery leadup to the American Declaration of Independence.

■ Cape Ann:
Discover the vistas and natural beauty of this quintessential New England coastline. Get a taste of the culture, hear the tragic and harrowing tale of the Perfect Storm, and learn why the locals find the call of the sea so impossible to resist. Then, cruise along a rocky coastline dotted by splendid beaches, perfect for catching some sun, surf, and serenity.

■ Cape Cod:
Marvel at Cape Cod’s unblemished coastline, hear about the rich seafaring history, and see the city where colonial history collides with a funky present. This tour combines the gorgeous beaches and historic villages of the Cape with the vibrant, quirky culture of Provincetown.

■ Salem:
This quaint Massachusetts town hides a chilling history, and you’ll learn all about it here. Walk these historic streets and uncover the story of the Salem Witch Trials, where a frenzy of paranoia and superstition drove the townspeople to turn against their own neighbors.

■ Lexington & Concord
Step back in time at the site of the “shot heard round the world.” Follow the course of the first battle of the Revolutionary War and witness the courage 
and ferocity of the minute men who took on the greatest military power in the world.

■ Plymouth

■ Boston Ghosts


■ Martha's Vineyard and many more coming along the way!

APP FEATURES:

■ Award-winning platform
The app, which has been featured on Thrillist and The Rhode Show, was the recipient of the famous Laurel Award from the Newport Mansions, who use Action Tour Guide for over a million tours per year.
 
■ Plays automatically
The app knows where you are and which direction you’re heading, and plays audio automatically about the things you are seeing, plus stories and tips and advice. Simply follow the GPS map & the routing line.

■ Fascinating stories
Be immersed in an engaging, accurate, and entertaining story about each point of interest. The stories are professionally narrated and prepared by local guides.

■ Works offline
No data, cellular or wireless connection needed! Download over Wi-Fi/Data before your tour. 

■ Freedom of travel
Explore on your own time, at your own pace, and with the flexibility to linger at stops that interest you. You have total freedom to skip ahead, stop and restart, and take as many photos as you’d like.


FREE DEMO:
Check out the free demo to get an idea of what this tour is all about. If you like it, purchase the tour to get access to all the stories.

QUICK TIPS:
Download ahead of time.
Be sure the phone battery is fully charged, or take an external battery. Continued GPS use dramatically decreases battery life.

Almost 400 magical places to swim in the wild in Britain. Containing all the content from the the best-selling travel book "Wild Swimming" by Daniel Start (Wild Things Publishing £16.99, second edition, 2013) this app provides all you need to visit hundreds of magical rivers, lakes and waterfalls across the UK. 

In this great British tour you’ll be able to swim with otters in Devon, go river-tubing in Yorkshire, night-swim under the stars in Oxfordshire and learn how to build a woodland sauna. In each area you can ready background chapters on famous wild-swimmers of the past and read stories of heroes, lovers and ordinary folk who have long enjoyed bathing under the willows. Perfect whether you are a wild swimmer, family paddler or just enjoy a waterside picnic.

NOTE: due to the large number of images and places the app is slow to load first time and may not work well (or crash) if many other apps are open in parallel. Please close other apps.

You will find preloaded maps, photos, directions and travel writing to inspire and inform. Most locations comes with stunning photography and some include detailed mapping (at 1:25,000 to help walkers and 1:250,000 to help with route-planning). There is contact information for nearby pubs, campsites and attractions. If you need inspiration you can browse the app by slideshow, list, photo gallery and on an interactive map.
